data.title: Hackley School
data.meta_description: Hackley School is a Kindergarten through 12th Grade day and boarding school located in Tarrytown New York, just outside of New York City.
data.text:
Gender: Coeducational Type: Day school Age range: 5 - 18

Hackley School is a Kindergarten through 12th Grade day and boarding school located in Tarrytown New York, just outside of New York City. The school inspires its students to grow in character and accomplishment though a mixture of academic, athletic, and creative ventures.

The IDEALS in our school

Wendt Global Issues Symposia; Community Studies Department courses; relationships with Round Square schools. Trips including NAIS Student Diversity Leadership, Model United Nations, Harvard/Yale Model Congresses, multicultural clubs Unity/AGSA; student projects, ambassadors and peer advisory, champion debate teams. Verdant 285 acre campus outside Manhattan: walking trails, deer exclusion zone; on campus composting/recycling; outdoor classroom; HEAL student gardening club. Adventure trips globally and to the U.S. National Parks in Wyoming; extra-curricular activities: fishing, rock climbing, and camping. Student-driven community service program and diversity groups; student government; leading roles in local and regional conferences and debates. Hackley students understand the value of work beyond “charity”; strong relationships with service organizations throughout Westchester Country and in New York City.

What being a Round Square school means to us

Round Square at Hackley is about connectivity- receiving exchange students and sending Hackley students to other schools, collaborating between classrooms, meeting peers at conferences, hosting visitors from other schools, and traveling as a group to global destinations. Round Square has reached all parts of our community – parents, students, faculty, staff, and Board of Trustees – and our curriculum reflects the IDEALS throughout the school k-12. Our proximity to New York City also allows Hackley to practice the IDEALS in a truly global metropolitan environment.
